info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 5:56PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN SANDOVAL AND WEST CENTRAL SANTA FE COUNTIES THROUGH 630 PM MDT... At 556 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from La Bajada to 6 miles southeast of San Felipe Pueblo. Movement was north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southwestern Santa Fe, Santo Domingo Pueblo, Cerrillos Hills State Park, Kewa Pueblo, Cochiti Pueblo, La Bajada, Madrid, La Cienega, Los Cerrillos and Cochiti Lake. This includes Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 253 and 275. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.
